noiDungVideo.noiDung:
Review Lesson 5 (1)
Indefinite pronouns: any, some, no, every + one/body/thing/where
(Đai từ bất định: any, some, no, every + one/body/thing/where)
Form and Function (Cấu trúc và Chức năng)
Chúng ta dùng đại từ bất định để chỉ ai, cái gì, con gì, vật gì chung chung, không xác định cụ thể.

Sử dụng any- trong câu hỏi hoặc câu phủ định. Ví dụ: I don't want to do anything.
Any- được sử dụng khi không chắc chắn liệu một người, địa điểm hoặc sự vật có tồn tại hay không. Ví dụ: Is anyone there?
Any- được sử dụng để chỉ tất cả người, địa điểm hoặc sự vật. Ví dụ: Anyone can do it.
Indefinite pronoun
(Đại từ bất định)		 Means ...
(Nghĩa là ...)
everything
everybody
everyone
everywhere		 all things
all people
all people
all places
nothing
nobody
no one
nowhere		 no things
no people
no people
no places
something
somebody
someone
somewhere		 an unknown thing
an unknown person
an unknown person
an unknown place
anything
anybody
anyone
anywhere		 non-specific things
non-specific people
non-specific people
non-specific place
Example (Ví dụ)
I love everything about Paris!
Everybody likes Anna.
Everyone knows you.
They go everywhere together.
There was nothing in his wallet.
Nobody told me the news.
No one lives here.
This is like nowhere on Earth.
I think I heard something.
Somebody heard us. Run!
Someone is watching them.
I need to go somewhere quiet.
Can you see anything?
I don't know anybody here!
There isn't anyone I can ask.
Is there anywhere we can go?

Review Lesson 5 (2)
Used to (Đã từng)
Function (Chức năng)
Use to được dùng để diễn đạt thói quen trong quá khứ nhưng nay không còn làm nữa.

Form (Cấu trúc)
Affirmative (Khẳng định)
I used to live here.
You do ballet.
He /
She		 play football.
It take a long time.
We go there.
They be friends.
Negative (Phủ định)
I didn't use to like it, but now I love it.
You recycle, but now you do.
He /
She		 exercise, but now he/she runs marathons.
It work, but I just fixed it.
We hang out, but now we meet every weekend.
They play soccer, but now they're good at it.
Questions (Câu hỏi)
Did I
you
he/she
it
we
they		 use to make up songs as a child?
work there?
go running?
play music?
go there often?
live here?

Comparative review & (not) as ... as
(Ôn tập so sánh hơn và so sáng bằng)
Function (Chức năng)
Chúng ta sử dụng so sánh hơn để so sánh một vật, người, hoặc địa điểm với một vật, người hoặc địa điểm khác.
Chúng ta sử dụng as ... as để chỉ ra hai thứ ngang bằng nhau. Chúng ta sử dụng (not) as ... as để chỉ ra hai thứ không ngang bằng nhau.
Form (Cấu trúc)
Adjectives with one syllable
(Tính từ một âm tiết)
My sister is quieter than I am.
Silvia is nicer than Ella.
Adjectives with two or more syllables
(Tính từ hai âm tiết trở lên)
Cities are more expensive than small words.
He is more handsome than his father.
Now I'm more ambitious than I was then.
Adjectives that end with -y and
have two syllables
(Tính từ hai âm tiết kết thúc bằng -y)
Horacio is happier than Frank.
I'm lazier than my sister is.
Irregular forms
(Tính từ bất quy tắc)
He's a better cook than his sister is.
New York is farther from her than Chicago is.

as ... as
(So sánh bằng)
She's as friendly as her daughter.
He's as tall as I am.
I'm as stressed as you are about this.
(not) as ... as
(So sánh không ngang bằng)
I'm not as creative as you are.
They're not as hard-working as we are.
She's not as optimistic as she used to be.
